prompt: <description>**Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Triangular Cutout** The first part of the CAD assembly is a rectangular prism with a triangular cutout on one of its faces. 1. *Create a new coordinate system:* - Set the Euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) - Set the translation vector to (0.0, 0.5, 0.0) 2. *Generate the 2D sketch:* - Draw the sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. - Create a rectangle by drawing lines: - Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.25, 0.0) - Line 2: Start Point (0.25, 0.0), End Point (0.25, 0.125) - Line 3: Start Point (0.25, 0.125), End Point (0.75, 0.125) - Line 4: Start Point (0.75, 0.125), End Point (0.75, 0.375) - Line 5: Start Point (0.75, 0.375), End Point (0.25, 0.375) - Line 6: Start Point (0.25, 0.375), End Point (0.25, 0.5) - Line 7: Start Point (0.25, 0.5), End Point (0.0, 0.5) - Line 8: Start Point (0.0, 0.5), End Point (0.0, 0.0) - Create a triangle by drawing lines: - Line 9: Start Point (0.75, 0.125), End Point (1.0, 0.375) - Line 10: Start Point (1.0, 0.375), End Point (0.75, 0.625) - Line 11: Start Point (0.75, 0.625), End Point (0.75, 0.125) 3. *Transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch:* - Apply the rotation using the Euler angles. - Apply the translation using the translation vector. 4. *Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model:* - The extrusion depth towards the normal is 0.5 units. - The extrusion depth opposite the normal is 0.0 units. - The scaling parameter for the sketch is 0.75. - The resulting operation is the creation of a new solid body (without explicitly mentioning 'NewBodyFeatureOperation'). **Dimensions:** - The length of the rectangular prism is approximately 0.75 units. - The width of the rectangular prism is approximately 0.5 units. - The height of the rectangular prism is approximately 0.75 units. Continue with the remaining parts following the same structure. This includes generating the 2D sketch with lines and arcs when necessary, transforming the sketch, and extruding it with the specified parameters. Remember to create a new coordinate system for each part and use descriptive language for the boolean operation instead of explicitly using the operation names.</description>
